tweets.text: The Affinity abstraction application required public consultation, the @EnvAgency did their best to hide this, in their consultation advert no mention of HS2. Despite the EAs best efforts fortunately the public did find this notice and asked some searching questions.

What's going on when residents are up half the night with burning eyes, nose and throats on a regular basis and no one seems to have the power to stop it? The truth will out one day. Let's hope soon #StopTheStink @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @MattHancock

tweets.text: Do something @EnvAgencyMids Stop @RedIndustries2 accepting waste, cap it off @WalleysL  landfill. Monitor. #StopTheStink Do something. Stop letting Red gas the residents of Newcastle Under Lyme.

@PJennings88 @AffinityWater @EnvAgency An exchange with some HS2 protagonists last week assured me that the tunnel will not affect the aquifer...I wasn't in the slightest bit convinced, and surprised there is a Green lobby for the project.

In the @AffinityWater application locations of the pumping stations were redacted. The @EnvAgency excuse ‚Äúcould compromise the security of public water supply assets‚Äù so building two HS2 tunnels through the aquifer does not compromise the security of public water supply??
There is more to follow on this compliant, complicit decision of the @EnvAgency to move abstraction volumes which facilitates HS2 polluting the aquifer.
